{{DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}} 2022-05-09 18:33:23 {{END_DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}}

                                           ##############, MSN
                                             ##################
                                               #########, ##
                                                  #####
                                          #####################

EDUCATION:
Marquette University, Milwaukee, WI                                                     1971 - 75
Bachelor of Science in Nursing

Boston University, Boston, MA                                                           1980 - 82
Master of Science in Nursing (MSN)

Certification and Licensure ,
American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), Adult Nurse Practitioner Certification ###########

Licensed Registered Nurse, ## Multi-state license ###########

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE:
Registered Nurse
United States Public Health Service Hospital, Brighton, MA                              1978 - 81
     * Responsible for medication, treatment, personal care, and discharge planning of in-patients on medical, surgical, and psychiatric units
     * Worked in variety of leadership positions as charge nurse and in-service education nurse
     * Provide comprehensive nursing care in variety of settings including caring for refugees in Cambodia and inmates/psychiatric patients

Adult Primary Care Nurse Practitioner                                                    1982 - 86
######### Hospital, #########, MA
    * Deliver high level of care to patients in the Employee Health Service, Occupation Health Program Latino Clinic, and primary care patients with wide range of acute and chronic problems 
    * Worked as part of dynamic interprofessional team including physician, social worker, and administrators

Substitute Registered Nurse                                                              2005 - 09
##### School District, #####, ##
    * Worked at least 2 days per week as a substitute school nurse, rotating at 6 schools total
    * Organized, updated, and maintained student health charts for more than 4,000 students enrolled in ##### School District
    * Evaluated and treated students presenting with asthma, upper respiratory infections, diabetes, and injuries 
    * Conducted school-wide vision and hearing checks
    * Administered influenza vaccinations to approximately 1,200 students and staff

Registered Charge Nurse                                                                  2009 - 12
Sisters of Mercy Health Systems, #########, ##
    * Worked three 12-hour shifts per week to provide high-quality, comprehensive age-appropriate nursing care to 45 residents at nursing home 
    * Supervise the care provided by nurse aids and non-professional nursing personnel
    * Delegate tasks nurse aides
    * Develop and implement care plans for all 45 residents
    * Communicate with off-site physician regarding treatment decisions

Nurse Practitioner                                                           June 2015 - January 2018

Corizon Correctional Health, #############, ##
    * Worked full-time as nurse practitioner to provide comprehensive health care, including conducting routine physical exams as required by law, to over 2,000 inmates
    * Deliver care to patients in the infirmary, including post-operative patients and those with terminal disease
    * Acted as lead health care provider for the Hepatitis C Clinic, assessing disease progression, conducting diagnostic work-up per consensus guidelines, and facilitating treatment
    * Evaluate acute medical complaints of the residents, and determine whether higher level of care was required
    * Consult with outside specialists at various hospitals regarding diagnosis and management of variety of conditions

COMMUNITY SERVICE/VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES:
Volunteer Nurse Program at Mercy Hospital                                            2007 - 10
Mercy Hospital, #########, ##
    * Volunteer in Otolaryngology Post-Anesthesia Care Unit to assess patients after anesthesia
    * Volunteer in GI lab to assess patients after procedures including sigmoidoscopies and colonoscopies
    * Volunteer in Emergency Department

Honors/Awards
Sigma Theta Tau international honor society of nurses                                  Inducted 1982
